definition: to stop breathing/to breathe one's last/to die/to cut the gas supply
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The sick man breathed his last at ten o'clock this morning.
sentences.chinese: 這個病人是今天上午10點斷氣的。

sentences.english: The old fellow croaked before he could tell us who shot him.
sentences.chinese: 那老人沒來得及告訴我們是誰向他開的槍就斷氣了。

sentences.english: It is unstopping exploration, until you exhaust money or pressure.
sentences.chinese: 它是一往直前的探索，直到你沒錢或者斷氣。

sentences.english: The old woman expired in agony.
sentences.chinese: 老婦在極度痛苦中斷氣。

sentences.english: Can laugh about people who breathe naturally also be crying quietly.
sentences.chinese: 能笑到快要斷氣的人自然也可以哭得無聲無息。

sentences.english: His father breathed his last this morning.
sentences.chinese: 他父親今天上午斷氣了。

sentences.english: I read your sentence and it'll kill me, cause you haven't write any interpunction .
sentences.chinese: 我念了你的話，因爲沒有標點符號，害得我差點斷氣。

sentences.english: This article analyses the construction and working principle of cutting-off air brake system.
sentences.chinese: 本文分析了農用掛車斷氣制動系統的結構和工作原理。

sentences.english: They were waiting for the old man to conk out.
It is humiliating to expire. The supreme floating visions are abject.
sentences.chinese: 這樣斷氣是恥辱的，最後飄浮着的幻影是卑賤的。

sentences.english: He expired in the arms of his beloved daughter .
sentences.chinese: 他是在他所鍾愛的女兒的懷抱中斷氣的。

sentences.english: They didn't pay the gas bill, the gas was cut off this morning.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有付煤氣費，今天早上斷氣了。

sentences.english: I didn't want Mary to see him die.
sentences.chinese: 我不願意讓瑪麗看着他斷氣。

definition: to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
